t: Psalm 109
For the director of music. Of David. A psalm.
My*pn God, whom I praise, do*ld not remain silent,
for*ln people who are wicked and deceitful have*ld opened their mouths against me; they*ld have spoken against me with lying tongues.
With*ln words of hatred they surround me; they*ld attack me without cause.
In*ln return for my friendship they accuse me, but*ld I am a man of prayer.
They*ln repay me evil for good, and*ld hatred for my friendship.
Appoint*pn someone evil to oppose my enemy; let*ld an accuser stand at his right hand.
When*ln he is tried, let him be found guilty, and*ld may his prayers condemn him.
May*ln his days be few; may*ld another take his place of leadership.
May*ln his children be fatherless and*ld his wife a widow.
May*ln his children be wandering beggars; may*ld they be driven from their ruined homes.
May*ln a creditor seize all he has; may*ld strangers plunder the fruits of his labor.
May*ln no one extend kindness to him or*ld take pity on his fatherless children.
May*ln his descendants be cut off, their*ld names blotted out from the next generation.
May*ln the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the Lord;*s may*ld the sin of his mother never be blotted out.
May*ln their sins always remain before the Lord,*s that*ld he may blot out their name from the earth.
For*pn he never thought of doing a kindness, but*ld hounded to death the poor and*ld the needy and the brokenhearted.
He*ln loved to pronounce a curse— may*ld it come back on him. He*ln found no pleasure in blessing— may*ld it be far from him.
He*ln wore cursing as his garment; it*ld entered into his body like water, into*ld his bones like oil.
May*ln it be like a cloak wrapped about him, like*ld a belt tied forever around him.
May*ln this be the Lord’s*s payment to my accusers, to*ld those who speak evil of me.
But*pn you, Sovereign Lord,*s help*ld me for your name’s sake; out*ld of the goodness of your love, deliver me.
For*ln I am poor and needy, and*ld my heart is wounded within me.
I*ln fade away like an evening shadow; I*ld am shaken off like a locust.
My*ln knees give way from fasting; my*ld body is thin and gaunt.
I*ln am an object of scorn to my accusers; when*ld they see me, they shake their heads.
Help*pn me, Lord*s my God; save*ld me according to your unfailing love.
Let*ln them know that it is your hand, that*ld you, Lord,*s have done it.
While*ln they curse, may you bless; may*ld those who attack me be put to shame, but*ld may your servant rejoice.
May*ln my accusers be clothed with disgrace and*ld wrapped in shame as in a cloak.
With*pn my mouth I will greatly extol the Lord;*s in*ld the great throng of worshipers I will praise him.
For*ln he stands at the right hand of the needy, to*ld save their lives from those who would condemn them.
